content: dreaming of happiness pattern and photos tiina kuu dreaming of happiness sock pattern was originally designed for roosa nauha pink ribbon campaign to raise funds for cancer research the finnish name of the design is unelma onnesta yarns and yardage main colour mc lystig merino sock 75 % merino 25 % nylon 424 m / 100 g 40-50 grams of grey november rain colourway contrast colour cc pirkanmaan kotityö roosa nauha sukkalanka 75 % wool 25 % nylon 420 m / 100 g 30-40 grams of pale pink colour code 57 size any fingering weight yarns can be used a there are instructions for sizes small 60 sts good contrast between the two colours is medium 66 sts and large 72 sts which are recommended referred to in the instructions as s m l if only one stitch count is given it applies to all sizes sizes s m l fit foot circumference of gauge approximately 19 21 23 cm / 7½ 8¼ 9 inches with some negative ease 32 sts and 44 row in stockinette stitch with smaller needles = 10 cm / 4 inches before you start needles please read the instructions carefully the back of the leg heel and sole are worked on at least 80 cm / 32 inch long circular needles needle 1 = the beginning of the round the 2 mm / us0 and 2 5 mm / us1½ or suitable to front of the leg and instep are worked on obtain gauge needle 2 = the end of the round socks can be knitted with dpns two shorter please note that if you have a dark cc and a circulars or a mini circular but the instructions light mc you can use the charts in reverse have been written for magic loop order that is work according to chart b in the leg and according to chart a in the foot in that case the chart key doesn t apply other supplies please note that the beginning of the round supplies for provisional cast on bor shifts occasionally use bor markers tapestry needle when preferred dreaming of happiness page 1/4 instructions folded picot cuff leg with the contrast colour cc and smaller work 9 rnds in stockinette stitch needles co 60 66 72 sts in total using the next round knit until 2 sts remain on needle 2 provisional cast on technique of your choice place a bor marker this is a temporary bor distribute sts as follows 30 32 36 sts on for the next 8 rnds needle 1 and 30 34 36 sts on needle 2 join to begin working in the round being careful switch to larger needles if preferred and not to twist attach main colour mc work according to chart a row 1-6 chart a is repeated 10 11 rnds 1-10 knit 12 times on the round round 11 work *yo k2tog* repeat * - * to the next round work according to chart a row 7 end
